add.text: This menu shows only templates that apply to the element you are editing. If, for example, you edit a CDA Observation element, only templates that apply to the "Observation" type (typically of type "Entry Templates" with a specialized context of "observation (Observation)") appear in this menu.
Text entered here appears in an exported Implementation Guide. It appears before the constraint definition.
Text entered here appears in an exported Implementation Guide. It appears after the constraint definition.
Clear this box to omit this constraint from the Schematron rules used by the conforming templates.
The context for any custom schematron is the top-level element of the template.
Specify a date representing the version of the valueset.

The notes for a constraint are used in IG review. For example, a note might indicate that a constraint requires some additional design, such as needing a value-set assigned to it. The contents of this field are not exported to the Implementation Guide.
Search for a specific conformance number in the tree.

Displays validation errors and warnings for the template. The validation results represent only template and constraint information that has been saved to the database (not including temporary changes).
